If you feel like some people just don't understand you even when you speak clearly, here are a few things you can do:

1. Rephrase your message: Try to rephrase what you are saying in a different way that may be more easily understood. Use simpler language or examples to clarify your message.

2. Check for understanding: After you've communicated something, check for understanding by asking some questions to ensure the other person has understood you correctly.

3. Repeat key points: Emphasize key points by repeating them or summarizing the conversation.

4. Listen actively: Listen carefully to the other person and understand their perspective. This will help you to better understand how to communicate your message effectively.

5. Avoid technical jargon: Avoid using technical jargon or words that may be difficult for the other person to understand.

6. Seek feedback: Ask for feedback from your coworkers, clients, or supervisor on your communication and language skills. It's possible they can provide useful insight into how you can improve.

Remember, effective communication is a two-way street. Both parties need to be actively involved in the conversation. If you have done everything on your part, and the other person is still not understanding you, try to remain patient and understanding.
